conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a capital punishment movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: I think I have just the right movie for you! Have you considered "The Green Mile" (1996)? It's a highly acclaimed and emotional ride, with Tom Hanks leading an all-star cast as a corrections officer who discovers the extraordinary abilities of a death row inmate played by Michael Jeter. The film explores themes of morality, justice, and humanity in a way that will surely leave you thinking long after the credits roll.

I think I have just the thing for you!

If you're looking for a historical war film that's both informative and engaging, I'd recommend "Tora! Tora! Tora!" (1970). This classic film tells the story of the infamous Pearl Harbor attack in a way that's both respectful and thrilling. With its all-star cast, including James Whitmore and Joseph Cotten, you're in for a treat!

If you're interested in something a bit more modern and romanticized, "Pearl Harbor" (2001) might be up your alley. This film takes a look at the events leading up to the attack, but also explores the personal stories of the people involved. With a talented cast, including Jaime King and Jennifer Garner, it's a great choice if you want to get swept up in a story!

Let me know if either of these catch your eye!
